docs.title: 主页
docs.text: Multi-Information X Enhanced Dynamic Language 中文官方文档

docs.title: MIXED Lang 简介
docs.text:
MIXED Lang (Multi-Information X Enhanced Dynamic Language) 是一种新的编程语言，它包含了当今所有编程语言的功能。MIXED Lang允许您动态制作程序。

MIXED Lang编译器基于Python 3，这使得它更易于维护。

docs.title: 开始的步骤
docs.text:
如果您擅长以下列出的所有领域，那么很容易开始使用MIXED Lang：

  • Python 开发
  • C/C++ 开发
  • Java 开发
  • HTML 开发
  • js 开发
  • PHP 开发

如果没有，你可以开始与 MIXED Lang 有一点准备。您必须按照以下步骤学习一些基本内容：

  1. 打开谷歌在您的浏览器中。（如果无法打开，也可以使用Bing。）
  2. 在屏幕中间找到一个输入框。
  3. 键入如何在一个月内学习6种编程语言，然后按Enter或者Return。
  4. 点击查看第一个搜索结果。
  5. 如果你还在看这一行，请继续学习列出的语言。一旦你完成了学习，你就可以继续学习MIXED Lang了。

docs.title: 太忙了，没时间学习6种语言？
docs.text: 单击此处，并获得更快的入门方式。

docs.title: 用法
docs.text:
正如我们所说的，MIXED Lang的编译器是基于Python 3的。因此，您应该使用Python 3通过以下命令编译MIXED Lang代码：

<python | python3> mixed.py <<filename>.mixed>

docs.title: 开发者
docs.text: 真_人工智障 CodeCrafter-TL NTF404

docs.title: 我的第一个MIXED程序
docs.text:
要想学编程语言，要先打印Hello World。以下是一个实例，用来打印Hello World： 

print("Hello World")

docs.title: 了解注释
docs.text:
写代码没有注释，大神也看不懂你的高难度代码。注释在代码中是极为重要的，MIXED的注释使用方法如下： 

// 这是个注释 类似Python中的 # 
/*
这是多行注释 类似Python中的 """ """
*/

docs.title: 关键字
docs.text:
MIXED不支持使用内部关键字赋值。以下是MIXED的全部关键字： 

print scan function class return import INIT cls method

docs.title: 数据类型
docs.text: MIXED的数据类型有多种，下面一个一个详解。

docs.title: 整型数值
docs.text: integer()是整型数值类型，如同Python的int()。

docs.title: 用法
docs.text:
int1 = integer()
int1.tobytes() // Python: int.to_bytes()
int1.type() // "<class integer at 内存地址>"

docs.title: 字符串
docs.text: string()是字符串类型，如同Python的str()。

docs.title: 用法
docs.text:
str1 = string()
str1.type() // "<class string at 内存地址>"

docs.title: 列表
docs.text: List()是列表类型，如同Python的list()。

docs.title: 用法
docs.text:
list1 = List()
list1.type() // "<class List at 内存地址>"

docs.title: 元组
docs.text: Tuple()是元组类型，如同Python的tuple()。

docs.title: 用法
docs.text:
tup1 = Tuple()
tup1.type() // "<class Tuple at 内存地址>"

docs.title: Home
docs.text: Multi-Information X Enhanced Dynamic Language English Document

docs.title: Introducing MIXED Lang
docs.text:
MIXED Lang (Multi-Information X Enhanced Dynamic Language) is a new programming language which contains features from every programming language that existed today. The MIXED Lang allows you to make your programm dynamically.

The MIXED Lang compiler is based on Python 3, which makes it much easier to maintain.

docs.title: To Get Started
docs.text:
It is easy to get started with MIXED Lang in case you are specialized in all of the fields listed below:

  • Python developing
  • C/C++ developing
  • Java developing
  • HTML developing
  • js developing
  • PHP developing

If not, you can get started with MIXED Lang with a little bit preparation. You will have to learn some basic stuff by following these steps:

  1. Open Google in your browser. (If you're not able to open it, use Bing instead is also OK.)
  2. Find an input box in the middle of your screen.
  3. Type How to learn 6 programming languages in a month and press Enter
  4. Look at the first result and take actions. No matter it seems helpful or not.
  5. If you're still looking at this line, please continue learning the listed languages. Once you finish learning them, you can continue getting started with MIXED Lang.

docs.title: Too busy to prepare by learning 6 languages?
docs.text: Click HERE and get a faster way to get started.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
As we have told, MIXED Lang's compiler is based on Python 3. So you should use Python 3 to compile your MIXED Lang code with the following command:

<python | python3> mixed.py <<filename>.mixed>

docs.title: Programmer
docs.text: Totowang-hhh CodeCrafter-TL NTF404

docs.title: My first MIXED program
docs.text:
To learn programming languages, you need to first print Hello World. Here is an example to print Hello World: 

print("Hello World")

docs.title: Understanding annotations
docs.text:
Writing code without comments, even experts cannot understand your high difficulty code. Annotations are extremely important in code, and the usage of annotations in MIXED is as follows: 

//This is an annotation similar to Python's#
/*
This is a multi line comment similar to the "" "" in Python
*/

docs.title: Keywords
docs.text:
MIXED does not support assigning values using internal keywords. Here are all the keywords for MIXED: 

print scan function class return import INIT cls method

docs.title: Data type
docs.text: There are multiple data types for MIXED, and each one will be explained in detail below.

docs.title: Integer value
docs.text: Integer() is an integer numerical type, similar to int() in Python.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
Int1 = integer()
Int1.tobytes() // Python: int.to_bytes()
Int1.type() // "<class integer at memory address>"

docs.title: String
docs.text: String() is a string type, similar to str() in Python.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
Str1 = string()
Str1.type() // "<class string at memory address>"

docs.title: List
docs.text: List() is a list type, similar to the list() in Python.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
List1 = List()
List1.type() // "<class List at memory address>"

docs.title: Tuple
docs.text: Tuple() is a tuple type, similar to the tuple() in Python.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
Tup1 = Tuple()
Tup1.type() // "<class Tuple at memory address>"
